page.title: 18CLUBS/RECREATION
page.content: The last few years have seen the growth of a number of flourishing new clubs and societies.Musically,these include an Amateur Operatic Society,an Ecumenical Church Choral Society, Barber Shop(ladies and mens).There are three Amateur Dramatic Societies, a Photographic Society,Cage Birds and Flower Arranging. Interest too has been shown in the heritage of the past and a new Heritage Society(1984) has regular attendance at monthly meetings of over 50. Traditional groups include:W.I.,Rotary,Round Table and a Masonic Lodge.For young people, apart from Swimming / Football Clubs and Church Youth CLubs, the new Leisure Centre and discos at the Miners Welfare, there is a singular lack of provision for the youth of the town. Allotment gardens are flourishing.
